name: abruptness
content:
abruptness noun [U]
(SUDDEN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being sudden, unexpected, and sometimes unpleasant: With dramatic abruptness, a decision was taken to close the school for good. Despite its abruptness, his departure came as no surprise.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was a certain abruptness about his departure.We weren't shocked, except by the abruptness of it.Darkness and light fluctuate with sudden and shocking abruptness.

abruptness noun [U]
(RUDE)
behaviour that seems rude and unfriendly, especially because of using very few words when talking: Her abruptness did not bother me. He regretted the abruptness of his question.
More examplesFewer examplesThere's a sharpness and abruptness to him.His abruptness of manner sometimes reminded me of his father.She was often criticized for her curtness and abruptness.
